article: Rudolph, a violin player, was not valued too much. One day, he traveled in a boat and was 21 _ in a storm. An old lighthouse man rescued him and led him into the lighthouse. After he had a long 22 _ with him, Rudolph learned more about the old man. Then 23 _ in the storm and the lighthouse and the old man lifted Rudolph 24 _ from his usual everyday 25 _ . He was filled with understanding and love. He was lifted to a 26 _ he had never known or 27 _ . He wanted to play music that showed the power of 28 _ and stars just for the old man. And 29 _ the storm and winds to join him, he stood and played the Kreutzer Sonata of Beethoven. The moments 30 _ . Moments that were days in the birth of fire and stars, moments of the 31 _ of all men, and finally moments that showed the 32 _ of all human spirit. Never 33 _ had Rudolph played with such power. 34 _ , waves and winds beat the lighthouse with giant hands. Above, the strong light 35 _ its life-saving beams across the dark and angry seas. Rudolph dropped his head to his chest, breathing 36 _ . The ocean threw its water over the land with the sound of many voices. The old man sat without moving, his wide old hand 37 _ on his knees. He thought about the storm outside--- music made by God. He thought of Rudolph and his music --- 38 _ were part of the works of nature --- both were works of 39 _ . He nodded his head up and down, then turned to Rudolph. "Yes," he said... "That is 40 _ !"
